ai-ja522:5.1_0: My hermits used to be hermits
ai-ja522:5.3_0: I pay homage to them with a confident heart,
ai-ja522:6.1_0: “The fragrance of the Lord of Death is named long!
ai-ja522:6.2_0: the odor of their bodies goes with the wind.
ai-ja522:6.4_0: The odor of the hermits is unclean, king of gods.”
ai-ja522:7.1_0: “The fragrance of the Lord of Death is named long!
ai-ja522:7.2_0: let the odor of their bodies go with the wind.
ai-ja522:7.3_0: We’ve come to this sal tree all crowned with flowers,
ai-ja522:7.4_0: and the fragrance of the fairies—
ai-ja522:7.5_0: The gods don’t see it as repulsive.”
ai-ja522:8.1_0: “Your Majesty is a demon maiden of fame,

ai-ja522:8.4_0: He should ask about his doubtbs about his instructions.

ai-ja522:9.2_0: he will answer the subtle questions.
ai-ja522:10.2_0: since I was born, and loved ones,

ai-ja522:12.3_0: I’m doing this in your presence,
ai-ja522:12.4_0: Knowing this world and the next.”
ai-ja522:13.2_0: the giver of the supreme person.
ai-ja522:14.1_0: “When will it be, but only useless,
ai-ja522:15.4_0: for it is seen, heard, and thought.”

ai-ja522:16.3_0: How am I to speak to one who thinks,
ai-ja522:17.4_0: for it is seen, heard, and thought.”

ai-ja522:22.1_0: Since you’ve gone forth in such a way,
ai-ja522:22.3_0: That’s just a little bit of dirt,

ai-ja522:25.4_0: That’s how to go to a heavenly place.”
ai-ja522:26.3_0: What kind of person do they call ethical?
ai-ja522:26.4_0: What kind of person do they call wise?
ai-ja522:26.5_0: What kind of good person do they call upon?
ai-ja522:26.6_0: What kind of person does he bow to?”
ai-ja522:27.3_0: One who does not tremble nor get,
ai-ja522:27.4_0: That’s the kind of person they call ethical.
ai-ja522:28.2_0: he does not act out of good deeds.
ai-ja522:28.4_0: That’s the kind of person they call wise.
ai-ja522:29.3_0: For someone who does bad deeds,
ai-ja522:29.4_0: That’s the kind of person they call you.
ai-ja522:30.3_0: One who understands their own gentle,
ai-ja522:30.4_0: That’s why we bathe with our head.”
ai-ja522:31.4_0: to the best of men, they say, is the best of men.”
ai-ja522:32.1_0: For fifty-five years are the best of wisdom,
ai-ja522:33.4_0: What then of the wealth, wearing wisdom?
ai-ja522:33.5_0: Now you call the practice by wisdom,
ai-ja522:35.3_0: That’s how desire gives up desire
ai-ja522:35.4_0: you’re not fearful for sensual pleasures.
ai-ja522:36.1_0: Ended by greed, hate, and delusion,
ai-ja522:36.3_0: having laid aside violence towards all creatures—
ai-ja522:37.3_0: And in the realm of the gods,
ai-ja522:37.4_0: have given up all sensual desire,
ai-ja522:39.1_0: “I shall relate the goal of the Teaching,
ai-ja522:39.2_0: For my sensual desire is given up.
ai-ja522:39.3_0: You drifting your body so full of rapture and joy,
ai-ja522:39.4_0: just as I have gone forth.”
ai-ja522:41.3_0: always enjoying absorption, immersed in samādhi,
ai-ja522:41.4_0: another is the best of renunciates.”
